alert.note: Alert for Northern Marinette County (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 31 at 9:02PM CDT until April 01 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND WIND EXPECTED ACROSS NORTHERN WISCONSIN... .Rain or a wintry mix will change to snow from northwest to southeast overnight. A band of heavy snow will set up across north central and far northeast Wisconsin, with less snow farther south. Strong north winds gusting to 45 mph will cause considerable blowing and drifting snow later tonight into Saturday morning, especially in open areas of north central and far northeast Wisconsin. A sharp cutoff in snow totals is expected on the southern end of this system. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected, possibly mixed with freezing rain or sleet early. Total snow accumulations between 9 and 13 inches and ice accumulations around a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, and producing considerable blowing and drifting snow in open areas late tonight into Saturday morning. * WHERE...Northern Marinette County County. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility in open areas. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
